unnormalised: What are some applications of AI in India right now?
normalised: What are some applications of A-I in India right now?

unnormalised: Well, bhai, AI is popping up everywhere in India! You see it in agriculture, like using drones to monitor fields. They're saying this can boost yields by 20% or something crazy. And then there's the whole banking sector, using AI for fraud detection – saves 'em tons of ₹₹₹. Also, companies like TCS and Infosys are really pushing AI solutions to clients globally.
normalised: Well, bhai, A-I is popping up everywhere in India! You see it in agriculture, like using drones to monitor fields. They're saying this can boost yields by twenty percent or something crazy. And then there's the whole banking sector, using A-I for fraud detection – saves 'em tons of rupees. Also, companies like T-C-S and Infosys are really pushing A-I solutions to clients globally.

unnormalised: Healthcare is another big one. AI’s being used to analyze X-rays and MRIs, helping doctors spot diseases earlier. Dr. Reddy's is also experimenting with AI to develop new drugs, which is pretty mind-blowing. Plus, there’s a ton of AI-powered chatbots helping people with customer service or answering FAQs – kinda like that "Ask Disha" on the IRCTC site, but way more advanced. I saw some news saying AI could add like $1 trillion to the Indian economy by 2035!
normalised: Healthcare is another big one. A-I's being used to analyze X-rays and M-R-Is, helping doctors spot diseases earlier. Doctor Reddy's is also experimenting with A-I to develop new drugs, which is pretty mind-blowing. Plus, there’s a ton of A-I-powered chatbots helping people with customer service or answering F-A-Qs – kinda like that "Ask Disha" on the I-R-C-T-C site, but way more advanced. I saw some news saying A-I could add like one trillion dollars to the Indian economy by two thousand and thirty five!

unnormalised: So yeah, it's not just hype. It's real and changing things on the ground. From farmers in Punjab to coders in Bangalore, AI is making waves. Just gotta keep an eye on it and see where it all leads, ya know? I heard there's some AI summit happening in Delhi on 15/12/2024 to discuss future applications too. Should be interesting!
normalised: So yeah, it's not just hype. It's real and changing things on the ground. From farmers in Punjab to coders in Bangalore, A-I is making waves. Just gotta keep an eye on it and see where it all leads, ya know? I heard there's some A-I summit happening in Delhi on fifteenth December two thousand and twenty four to discuss future applications too. Should be interesting!
